title: Elon Musk revives lawsuit against OpenAI, Sam Altman in federal court
content: Elon Musk has revived a lawsuit against Sam Altman in a federal court, alleging that the Tesla boss was manipulated into co-founding OpenAI, according to a court filing published on Monday.
summary: Elon Musk has revived a lawsuit against Sam Altman in a federal court, alleging that the Tesla boss was manipulated into co-founding OpenAI, according to a court filing published on Monday.

title: Investors are unwinding the biggest ‘carry trade’ the world has ever seen, SocGen strategist says
content: Carry trades refer to trades wherein an investor borrows in a currency with low interest rates and reinvests the proceeds in higher-yielding assets elsewhere.
summary: Carry trades refer to trades wherein an investor borrows in a currency with low interest rates and reinvests the proceeds in higher-yielding assets elsewhere.

title: Ukraine finally sends F-16s into the battle against Russia — but they might not be a game-changer
content: It was a pivotal moment for Ukraine as it unveiled its first F-16 fighter jets on Sunday. The difference the aircraft will make in battle remains to be seen.
summary: It was a pivotal moment for Ukraine as it unveiled its first F-16 fighter jets on Sunday. The difference the aircraft will make in battle remains to be seen.

title: The Fed is trying to 'fight a ghost' as recession fears mount, investor says
content: The Federal Reserve may have little room for manoeuvre, as a global market sell-off continues amid fears of a looming U.S. recession, investor Cole Smead warned.
summary: The Federal Reserve may have little room for manoeuvre, as a global market sell-off continues amid fears of a looming U.S. recession, investor Cole Smead warned.

title: SoftBank shares tank near 19%, wiping off $4.6 billion from founder Masayoshi Son's fortune
content: SoftBank CEO Masayoshi Son's net worth fell by $4.6 billion on Monday, according to the Forbes real-time billionaires list.
summary: SoftBank CEO Masayoshi Son's net worth fell by $4.6 billion on Monday, according to the Forbes real-time billionaires list.

title: Japan's Nikkei logs worst day since 1987 Black Monday crash
content: The 12.4% loss on the Nikkei was the worst day for the index since the "Black Monday" of 1987.
summary: The 12.4% loss on the Nikkei was the worst day for the index since the "Black Monday" of 1987.

title: U.S. expat who's lived in Italy, France and more: If you want to move to Europe, here's my best advice

title: 'Never quit your job,' says early retiree and self-made multimillionaire: Do this instead
content: Financial Samurai founder Sam Dogen says you're better off financially negotiating a layoff rather than quitting if you're unhappy at work.
summary: Financial Samurai founder Sam Dogen says you're better off financially negotiating a layoff rather than quitting if you're unhappy at work.

title: Monex Group’s Jesper Koll says he is prepared to ‘start buying Japan' despite major stock sell-off
content: Jesper Koll, head of Japan at Monex Group, says he is prepared to "start buying Japan" even as Japanese markets experienced a major stock-sell off on Monday.
summary: Jesper Koll, head of Japan at Monex Group, says he is prepared to "start buying Japan" even as Japanese markets experienced a major stock-sell off on Monday.

title: Wharton's Jeremy Siegel says Fed needs to make an emergency rate cut
content: Wharton's Jeremey Siegel called on the Fed to make an emergency 75 basis-point cut in the federal funds rate after Friday's jobs report.
summary: Wharton's Jeremey Siegel called on the Fed to make an emergency 75 basis-point cut in the federal funds rate after Friday's jobs report.

title: Crypto selloff wipes out $367 billion in value as bitcoin, ether plunge
content: Bitcoin and ethereum suffered steep drops on Sunday as investors sold out of risky assets.

title: A global stock sell-off is deepening with investors fleeing to safe havens
content: Investors are turning to safe haven assets like the U.S. Treasurys and Swiss franc, as the global stocks sell-off deepens.

title: Taiwan under pressure to bolster its defense as Trump-Harris presidential race stokes policy concerns
content: Experts say that Taiwan is under more pressure to build up its defense capabilities and deterrence in the face of uncertainty in the upcoming U.S. elections.

title: No passports needed: Singapore launches biometric immigration processing at Changi Airport
content: Singapore launches trials for travelers to clear immigration at Changi Airport using biometric data in lieu of passport checks.

title: Retiring Corvette 'godfather' on EVs, spinoff and a performance SUV
content: The "godfather" of GM's modern day Corvettes Tadge Juechter retired Wednesday after roughly 47 years with the automaker, including 31 years devoted to Corvette.

title: 'Underconsumption core' is in — and not a moment too soon, I say

title: Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway sold nearly half its stake in Apple
content: Berkshire disclosed an $84.2 billion stake in Apple at the end of the second quarter, suggesting that Buffett offloaded more than 49% of the tech stake.

title: Singapore's monetary authority sets up review group in bid to revive its equities market

title: Warren Buffett raises Berkshire cash level to record $277 billion after slashing stock holdings

title: Google pulls AI ad for Olympics following backlash
